intro: Isatis pyramidata, commonly known as Chinese yellow flag, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has palmately divided leaves and produces long, slender seed pods. It thrives in moist environments and is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. Its historical use in traditional medicine and as a dye source adds to its botanical significance.
